situationalFactors.homeFieldAdvantage: Kyle Field 12th Man - one of college football's most intimidating venues
situationalFactors.momentumShift: Texas A&M riding 3-game win streak after slow start
situationalFactors.mizzouStruggles: Missouri 1-4 in road SEC games, averaging 17.2 PPG away from home
situationalFactors.motivationEdge: A&M fighting for SEC Championship Game berth

keyFactors.title: Kyle Field Dominance
keyFactors.description: Texas A&M was 6-0 at home entering this game, winning by average margin of 18.3 points. The 12th Man crowd creates massive home field advantage in SEC play.

keyFactors.title: Missouri Road Woes
keyFactors.description: Mizzou entered 1-4 in true road games (excluding neutral sites), with losses by 14, 10, 21, and 7. Road SEC environment historically crushing for Tigers' up-tempo offense.

keyFactors.title: Defensive Mismatch
keyFactors.description: Texas A&M ranked 12th in total defense (302.1 YPG allowed). Missouri ranked 68th in offensive efficiency. A&M's defensive line averaged 3.2 sacks/game, targeting Mizzou's inconsistent pass protection.

keyFactors.title: Rushing Attack Advantage
keyFactors.description: A&M's Le'Veon Moss averaged 6.2 YPC at home vs 4.1 on road. Missouri allowed 178.3 rushing yards/game in SEC play - exploitable weakness.

riskFactors: Missouri's dual-threat QB capable of explosive plays
A&M tendency to start slow before halftime adjustments
Weather conditions (potential rain) could tighten game

scoringBreakdown.description: A&M TD 7-0 - Dominant opening drive (78 yards, 6:42 TOP). Le'Veon Moss 3-yard TD run capped 10-play march.
A&M FG 10-0, Mizzou TD 10-7, A&M TD 17-7 - A&M extended lead before Mizzou answered with TD. A&M responded immediately with 4-play, 75-yard TD drive. Half: 17-7.
A&M TD 24-7, A&M FG 27-7, Mizzou FG 27-10 - A&M dominated time of possession (9:47 vs 5:13), extending lead to 20 points before Mizzou FG.
A&M TD 34-10, Mizzou TD 34-17, A&M FG 38-17 - A&M sealed victory with 12-play, 6:18 TD drive. Mizzou scored garbage-time TD before A&M added late FG. Final: 38-17.

gameResults.whenCleared: Late Q3 (A&M led 27-10, covering spread with 3:22 left in quarter)
gameResults.gamePace: A&M controlled tempo completely - 34:17 time of possession. Missouri's up-tempo offense stifled by Kyle Field noise and A&M's ball control.

whatWentRight.title: Kyle Field Erupted
whatWentRight.description: 12th Man forced 4 Missouri false starts and 2 delay of game penalties. Crowd noise disrupted Mizzou's up-tempo rhythm, forcing 3 turnovers (2 INT, 1 fumble).

whatWentRight.title: Le'Veon Moss Dominated
whatWentRight.description: A&M's RB posted 187 rushing yards on 28 carries (6.7 YPC) with 2 TDs. Exactly exploited Missouri's run defense weakness (178.3 YPG allowed in SEC play).

whatWentRight.title: Time of Possession Stranglehold
whatWentRight.description: A&M held ball for 34:17 (57.2%), limiting Missouri to just 8 offensive possessions. Ball control suffocated Mizzou's explosive offense.

whatWentRight.title: Defensive Line Dominance
whatWentRight.description: A&M recorded 5 sacks and 11 QB hurries, neutralizing Missouri's passing attack. Mizzou QB completed just 18-of-34 (52.9%) under constant pressure.

statisticalContext.vsProjection: A&M scored 5.8 above season avg, Mizzou scored 9.2 below road avg
statisticalContext.homeFieldImpact: +11.5 point swing vs A&M's neutral site performance
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 92nd percentile margin of victory for A&M home games

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV - line moved toward A&M as public money pounded home favorite. Sharp action recognized Kyle Field value early.

keyTakeaways: Kyle Field home atmosphere is worth 8-10 points vs SEC road opponents
Missouri's road struggles (1-4 in true road games) were systemic, not variance
Targeting teams with rushing attack advantage (6.2 YPC) vs weak run defenses (178.3 YPG) = consistent edge
Time of possession dominance (34:17 vs 25:43) suffocates explosive offenses
Covered by 14.5 points - dominated wire-to-wire exactly as projected
verdict: Perfect home favorite spot. Kyle Field advantage + Missouri road woes + rushing mismatch = dominant cover performance.
